lines.gurmukhi: 1 mMglwcrx vsqU inrdyS
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: pUrw siqgur jwxIAY pUry pUrw Qwt bxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Pooraa Satiguru Jaaneeai Pooray Pooraa Daatu Banaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: One should understand the perfect true Guru who has created the grandeur  (of creation) around.

lines.gurmukhi: pUry pUrw swDsMgu pUry pUrw mMqRR diRVwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Pooray Pooraa Saadhasangu Pooray Pooraa Mantr Drirhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The holy congregation of the complete is perfect and  that perfect has recited the perfect mantra.

lines.gurmukhi: pUry pUrw iprm rsu pUrw gurmuiK pMQu clwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Pooray Pooraa Piram Rasu Pooraa Guramoukhi Pandu Chalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The perfect has created the  complete love for the Lord and has ordained the gurmukh way of life.

lines.gurmukhi: pUry pUrw drsxo pUry pUrw sbdu suxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Pooray Pooraa Darasano Pooray Pooraa Sabadu Sounaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The  sight of perfect is perfect and the same perfect has caused to hear the  perfect word.

lines.gurmukhi: pUry pUrw bYhxw pUry pUrw qKqu rcwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Pooray Pooraa Baihanaa Pooray Pooraa Takhatu Rachaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His sitting is also perfect and his throne is also perfect.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq scu KMf hY Bgiq vCl huie vsgiq AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Sachu Khandu Hai Bhagati Vachhalu Hoi Vasagati Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The  holy congregation is the abode of truth and being kind to the devotee, He  is in the possession of the devotees.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq scu nwau gur igAwnu iDAwnu isKw smJwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachu Roopu Sachu Naau Gur Giaanu Dhiaanu Sikhaa Samajhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru, out of his sheer love for  the Sikhs, has made them understand the true nature of the Lord, the true  name and the knowledge-producing meditation.

lines.gurmukhi: gur cyly prcw prcwieAw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Chaylay Parachaa Parachaaiaa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru has immersed  the disciple in the way of life.

lines.gurmukhi: auho hI

Shabad OS B.translation: Invocation

lines.gurmukhi: krx kwrx smrQu hY swDsMgiq dw krY krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Karan Kaaran Samaradu Hai Saadhasangati Daa Karai Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: All competent God Himself is the efficient as well as material cause of all  but He does everything according to the will of the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: BrY BMfwr dwqwr hY swDsMgiq dw dyie idvwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bharai Bhandaar Daataaru Hai Saadhasangati Daa Dayi Divaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The  stores of that bestower are full but he gives according to the wishes of the  holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm gur rUpu hoie swDsMgiq gur sbd smwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabraham Gur Roopu Hoi Saadhasangati Gur Sabadi Samaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: That transcendental Brahm, by being the Guru, enrapts  the holy congregation into the Word, sabad.

lines.gurmukhi: jg Bog jog iDAwn kir pUjw prY n drsnu pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jag Bhog Jog Dhiaanu Kari Poojaa Parai N Darasanu Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His glimpse can not be had by  performing of yajna, offering sweets, yoga, concentration, ritualistic  worship and ablutions.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq ipau puqu hoie idqw Kwie pYnHY pYnHwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Piu Poutu Hoi Ditaa Khaai Painhai Painhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fellows in the holy congregation maintain father-son  relationship with the Guru,

lines.gurmukhi: GrbwrI hoie vriqAw GrbwrI isK pYrI pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gharabaaree Hoi Varatiaa Gharabaaree Sikh Pairee Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: And whatever he gives to eat and put on, they eat  and wear.

lines.gurmukhi: mwieAw ivic audwsu rKwieAw ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Maaiaa Vichi Udaasu Rakhaaiaa ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: God remains detached in maya.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 gurmuKwN dI in`q kiRXw

Shabad OS B.translation: Daily routine of Gurmukhs

lines.gurmukhi: AMmiRq vyly auiT kY jwie AMdir drIAwie nHvMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Anmrit Vaylay Outdi Kai Jaai Andari Dareeaau Nhavanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting up at the ambrosial hour of morning the Sikhs bathe in the river.

lines.gurmukhi: shij smwiD AgwiD ivic iek min hoie gur jwpu jpMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Sahaji Samaadhi Agaadhi Vichi Ik Mani Hoi Gur Jaapu Japanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: By putting their mind in the unfathomable God through deep  concentration, they remember Guru, the God by reciting Japu (Ji).

lines.gurmukhi: mQY itky lwl lwie swDsMgiq cil jwie bhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Madai Tikay Laal Laai Saadhasangati Chali Jaai Bahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting fully activated then they go to join the holy congregation of the saints.

lines.gurmukhi: sbdu suriq ilvlIxu hoie siqgur bwxI gwie suxMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadu Surati Liv Leenu Hoi Satigur Baanee Gaai Sounanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming absorbed in remembering and loving the sabad they sing and  hear the Guru's hymns.

lines.gurmukhi: Bwie Bgiq BY vrqmwn gur syvw gurpurb krMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaai Bhagati Bhai Varatimaani Gur Sayvaa Gurapurab Karanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: They love to spend their time in meditation,  service and fear of God and they serve the Gum by observing his  anniversaries.

lines.gurmukhi: sMJY sodru gwvxw mn mylI kir myil imlMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Sanjhai Sodaru Gaavanaa Man Maylee Kari Mayli Miladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They sing the Sodar in the evening and heartily associate  with one another.

lines.gurmukhi: rwqI kIriq soihlw kir AwrqI prswd vMfMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Raatee Keerati Sohilaa Kari Aaratee Parasaadu Vandanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having recited the Sohila and made supplication at night  they distribute sacred food (prasad).

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuK suK Plu iprm cKMdy ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Chakhanday ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus gurmukhs gladly taste the fruit  of happiness.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 swD sMgiq-scKMf

Shabad OS B.translation: Holy congregation, abode the truth -

lines.gurmukhi: iek kvwau pswau kir EAMkwir Akwr pswrw
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Kavaau Pasaau Kari Aoankaari Akaaru Pasaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Oankar Lord, with one resonance created the forms.

lines.gurmukhi: paux pwxI bYsMqro Driq Awgwsu Dry inrDwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Paoun Paanee Baisantaro Dharati Agaasu Dharay Niradhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Air, water, fire,  sky and earth He sustained (in his order) without any support.

lines.gurmukhi: rom rom ivic riKEnu kir vrBMf kroiV Akwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Rom Rom Vichi Rakhiaonu Kari Varabhand Karorhi Akaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of  universe exist in his each trichome.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm pUrn bHm Agm Agocr AlK Apwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Agam Agocharu Alakh Apaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He the transcendental Brahm is the  complete   (within  and  without),   inaccessible,   imperceptible  incomprehensible and infinite.

lines.gurmukhi: iprm ipAwlY vis hoie Bgiq vCl hoie isrjxhwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Piram Piaalai Vasi Hoi Bhagati Vachhal Hoi Sirajanahaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He remains in the control of loving  devotion and by becoming kind to the devotees, He creates.

lines.gurmukhi: bIau bIij Aiq sUKmo iqdU hoie vf ibrK ivQwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Beeu Beeji Ati Sookhamo Tidoon Hoi Vad Birakh Vidaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is the  subtle seed that takes form of the large tree of creation.

lines.gurmukhi: Pl ivic bIau smwiekY iek dUM bIAhu lK hjwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Phal Vichi Beeu Samaai Kai Ik Doon Beeahu Lakh Hajaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The fruits contain  seeds and then from one seed millions of fruits are created.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuK suK Pl iprm rsu gurisKwN siqgurU ipAwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Piram Rasu Gurasikhaan Satiguroo Piaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sweet  fruit of Gurmukhs is the love of Lord and the Sikhs of Guru love the true  Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq scKMf ivic siqgur purKu vsY inrMkwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Sachu Khand Vichi Satigur Purakhu Vasai Nirankaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the holy congregation, the abode of truth, the supreme formless  Lord resides.

lines.gurmukhi: Bwie Bgiq gurmuiK insqwrw ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaai Bhagati Guramoukhi Nisataaraa ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurmukhs get liberated through loving devotion.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 jpujI AMqly slok pvx gurU dw ArQ

Shabad OS B.translation: The meaning of the 38th stanza of japuji-pavn-Guru pani pita

lines.gurmukhi: paux gurU gur sbdu hY vwihgurU gur sbd suxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Paounu Guroo Gur Sabadu Hai Vaahaguroo Gur Sabadu Sounaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru's word is the air, the Guru and wondrous lord has recited Word the  Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI ipqw pivqRR kir gurmuiK pMQ invwix clwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Pitaa Pavitr Kari Guramoukhi Panthi Nivaani Chalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The father of man is water which by flowing downwards teaches humility.

lines.gurmukhi: DrqI mwq mhq kir Eiqpoiq sMjogu bxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dharatee Maat Mahatu Kari Aoti Poti Sanjogu Banaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The earth being tolerant like mother is the mother and is the further base of all the  creatures.

lines.gurmukhi: dweI dwieAw rwiq idhu bwl suBwie jgqRR iKlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Daaee Daaiaa Raati Dihu Baal Soubhaai Jagatr Khilaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The day and night are the nurses who keep the people of child-wisdom  busy in the plays of the world.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK jnm skwrQw swDsMgiq vis Awpu gvwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Janamu Sakaaradaa Saadhasangati Vasi Aapu Gavaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The life of Gurmukh is meaningful because he in  the holy congregation has lost his egotism.

lines.gurmukhi: jMmx mrxhu bwhry jIvn mukiq jugiq vrqwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Janman Maranahu Baaharay Jeevan Moukati Jougati Varataaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He becoming liberated in life behaves  in the 'world with the skill to come out of the cycle of transrnigration.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq mwqw miq hY ipqw sMqoK moK pdu pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Maataa Mati Hai Pitaa Santokh Mokh Padu Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The mother  of the gurmukhs is the wisdom of the Guru and father, the contentment through  whom they attain deliverance.

lines.gurmukhi: DIrj Drmu iBrwv duie jpu qpu jqu squ puq jxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dheeraju Dharamu Bhiraav Dui Japu Tapu Jatu Satu Pout Janaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Forbearance and the sense of duty are their  brothers, and meditation, austetities, continence the sons.

lines.gurmukhi: gur cylw cylw gurU purKhu purK clqu vrqwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Chaylaa Chaylaa Guroo Purakhahu Purakh Chalatu Varataaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru and the  disciple are diffused into one another in equanirnity and they both are the  extension of the perfect supreme Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu AlKu lKwieAw ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakhu Lakhaaiaa ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: Raving realized the supreme pleasure they  have made others also realize the same.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 inrlypqw pur diRSit

Shabad OS B.translation: Detachment

lines.gurmukhi: pr Gr jwie prwhuxw Awsw ivic inrwsu vlwey
lines.transliteration_english: Par Ghar Jaai Paraahounaa Aasaa Vichi Niraasu Valaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The guest in the house of other person remains unconcerned among many  expectations.

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI AMdir kvl ijau sUrj iDAwnu Ailpqu rhwey
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Andari Kaval Jiu Sooraj Dhiaanu Alipatu Rahaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Lotus too in the water concentrates upon sun and remains- uninfluenced  by water.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq siqsMig imil gur cyly dI sMiD imlwey
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Satisangi Mili Gur Chaylay Dee Sandhi Milaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Likewise in the holy congregation the Guru and disciple  meet through word (sabad) and meditative faculty(surati).

lines.gurmukhi: cwr vrn gurisK hoie swDsMgiq scKMf vswey
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Varan Gurasikh Hoi Saadhasangati Sach Khand Vasaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: People of the four  varnas, by becoming followers of the Guru, reside in the abode of truth through  the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gvwie qMbol rsu Kwie cbwie su rMg cVHwey
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Gavaai Tanbol Rasu Khaai Chabaai Su Rang Charhhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Like the one coloured sap of betel-leaf they shed away  their selfhood, and all are coloured in their one fast colour.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA drsn qrsn KVy bwrh pMQ igrMQ suxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Darasan Tarasan Kharhay Baarah Panthi Girand Sounaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the six  philosophies and the twelve sects of yogis covet by standing away (but do not get  that status because of their pride).

lines.gurmukhi: iCA ruiq bwrh mws kir ieku ieku sUrju cMd idKwey
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Routi Baarah Maas Kari Iku Iku Sooraju Chandu Dikhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Six seasons, twelve months are shown to have  one sun and one moon,

lines.gurmukhi: bwrh solh myilkY ssIAr AMdir sUr smwey
lines.transliteration_english: Baarah Solah Mayli Kai Saseear Andari Soor Samaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: But the gurmukhs have fused the sun and the moon into  each other, i.e. they have demolished the boundries of the sattva and the rajas  gunas.

lines.gurmukhi: isv skqI nUM lMiG kY gurmuiK iek min ieku iDAwey
lines.transliteration_english: Siv Sakatee No Laghi Kai Guramoukhi Iku Manu Iku Dhiaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having gone beyond the rnaya of Siva-sakti they medicate upon the one supreme.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY jgu pYrI pwey ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Jagu Pairee Paaay ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Their humility makes the world fall at their feet.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 gurmuK rihxI

Shabad OS B.translation: Conduct of Gurmukhs

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdys Avys kir pYrI pY rhrwis krMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Oupadays Adaysu Kari Pairee Pai Raharaasi Karanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Considering the sermon of the Guru as the order they observe the code being bumble.

lines.gurmukhi: crx srix msqku Drin crn ryx muiK iqlk suhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Sarani Masataku Dharani Charan Raynu Moukhi Tilak Suhanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: They surrender at the feet of Guru and apply he dust of  his-feet to their heads.

lines.gurmukhi: Brm krm dw lyK myit lyKu AlyK ivsyK bxMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Bharam Karam Daa Laykhu Mayti Laykhu Alaykh Visaykh Bananday.

Shabad OS B.translation: By effacing the delusive writings of destiny, they  create special love for imperceptible God.

lines.gurmukhi: jgmg joiq audoq kir sUrj cMd n lK pujMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Jagamag Joti Udotu Kari Sooraj Chand N Lakh Pujanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Myriads of suns and moons  cannot reach their effulgence.

lines.gurmukhi: haumY grbu invwirkY swDsMgiq sc myil imlMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Haoumai Garabu Nivaari Kai Saadhasangati Sar Mayli Miladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Deleting ego from themselves they take dip  into the sacred tank of the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq pUrn bHm crx kml pUjw prcMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Pooran Brahamu Charan Kaval Poojaa Parachanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Holy congregation is the  abode of the perfect Brahm and they (gurmukhs) keep their mind imbued  with the lotus feet (of Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: suK sMpt hoie Bvr vsMdy ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Soukh Sanpati Hoi Bhavar Vasanday ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: They become the black bee and reside in the  pleasure-petals (of the holy Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: 8 igAwnI l`Cx

Shabad OS B.translation: Characteristics of a knowledgeable person

lines.gurmukhi: gur drsn prsxu sPlu iCA drsnu iek drsnu jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Darasanu Parasanu Saphalu Chhia Darasanu Ik Darasanu Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Blessed is the Glimpse and the company of the guru because there only one visualizes God alone in all the six philosophies.

lines.gurmukhi: idb idsit prgwsu kir lok vyd gur igAwn pCwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Dib Disati Paragaasu Kari Lok Vayd Gur Giaanu Pachhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting enlightened one identifies the teachings of Guru even in secular affairs

lines.gurmukhi: eykw nwrI jqI hoie pr nwrI DI BYx vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Aykaa Naaree Jatee Hoi Par Naaree Dhee Bhain Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having one women as wife he (the Sikh) is a celebate and considers any other's wife as his daughter or a sister.

lines.gurmukhi: pr Dn sUAr gwie ijau mkrUh ihMdU muslmwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Par Dhanu Sooar Gaai Jiu Makarooh Hindoo Mousalamaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: To covet another man's property is forbidden ( to a Sikh) as the swine is to the Muslim and the cow to a Hindu.

lines.gurmukhi: Gr bwrI gur isK hoie isKw sUqRR ml mUqRR ivfwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghar Baaree Gur Sikhu Hoi Sikhaa Sootr Mal Mootr Vidaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sikh being a householder abnegates tonsure,the sacred thread ( Janeau), etc and forsakes them like abdominable faeces.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm pUrn bHm igAwn iDAwn gurisK is\\\\wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Giaanu Dhiaanu Gurasikh Siaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh of the Guru accepts transcendental Lord as the sole found af higher knowledge and the meditation.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq imil piq prvwxY ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Mili Pati Paravaanai ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the congregation of such people any body could become authentic as well as respectable.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 eISvrIX SkqI

Shabad OS B.translation: The divine power

lines.gurmukhi: gweI bwhly rMg ijau KVu cir duDu dyin iek rMgI
lines.transliteration_english: Gaaee Baahalay Rang Jiu Kharhu Chari Dudhu Dayni Ik Rangee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Though the cows are of different hues yet their milk is of the same (white) colour.

lines.gurmukhi: bwhly ibrK vxwspiq AgnI AMdir hY bhu rMgI
lines.transliteration_english: Baahalay Birakh Vanaasapati Aganee Andari Hai Bahu Rangee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The vegetation has variety of trees but is the fire therein of  different colours?

lines.gurmukhi: rqnw vyKY sBu ko rqn pwrKU ivrlw sMgI
lines.transliteration_english: Ratanaa Vaykhai Sabhu Ko Ratan Paarakhoo Viralaa Sangee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many behold the jewels but the jeweller is a rare  person.

lines.gurmukhi: hIry hIrw byiDAw rqn mwl siqsMgiq cMgI
lines.transliteration_english: Heeray Heeraa Baydhiaa Ratan Maal Satisangati Changee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the diamond interlaced with other diamonds goes in the  company of jewels, likewise the mind-diamond intertwined with the diamond like Guru Word goes in the string of the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: AMmiRqu ndir inhwilEnu hoie inhwlu n hor sumMgI
lines.transliteration_english: Anmritu Nadari Nihaaliaonu Hoi Nihaalu N Hor Su Mangee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Knowledgeable people get blessed with the ambrosial sight of the Guru  and then have no desire whatsoever.

lines.gurmukhi: idb dyh idb idsit hoie pUrn bHm joiq AMg AMgI
lines.transliteration_english: Dib Dayh Dib Disati Hoi Pooran Braham Joti Ang Angee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Their body and vision turns divine  and their every limb reflects the divine light of the perfect Brahm.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq siqgur shlMgI ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Satigur Sahalagee ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: Their  relations with the true Guru are established through the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 gurmuK Dwrnw

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv swDsMig pMc sbd iek sbd imlwey
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Saadhasangi Panch Sabad Ik Sabad Milaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Gurmukh while immersing his meditational faculty in the Word  listens to the Word alone even through the five types of sounds (created  through many instruments).

lines.gurmukhi: rwg nwd sMbwd liK BwiKAw Bwau suBwau Alwey
lines.transliteration_english: Raag Naad Lakh Sabad Lakhi Bhaakhiaa Bhaau Soubhaau Alaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Considering the ragas and nadas only as the  medium, the Gurmukh discusses and  recites with love.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK bHm iDAwn Duin jwxY jMqRRI jMqR vjwey
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Braham Dhiaanu Dhouni Jaanai Jantree Jantr Vajaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Only the Gurmukhs understand the melody of the knowledge of the supreme reality.

lines.gurmukhi: AkQ kQw vIcwrkY ausqiq inMdw vrij rhwey
lines.transliteration_english: Akad Kadaa Veechaari Kai Ousatati Nidaa Varaji Rahaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikhs ponder on the words of the Ineffable, and abstain from praise  and blame.

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdys Avysu kir imTw bolxu mn prcwey
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Oupadaysu Avaysu Kari Mitdaa Bolanu Man Parachaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Allowing the Guru's instruction to enter their hearts they  speak politely and thus comfort one another.

lines.gurmukhi: jwie imlin guV kIiVAwN rKY rKxhwr lukwey
lines.transliteration_english: Jaai Milani Gurh Keerhiaan Rakhai Rakhanahaaru Loukaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikhs' virtues cannot be  concealed.  As a man may hide mollasses, but ants will discover it.

lines.gurmukhi: gMnw hoie kolU pIVwey ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Gannaa Hoi Koloo Peerhaaay ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: As the  sugarcane gives juice when pressed in a mill, so must a Sikh suffer while  conferring favours on others.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 gurmuK Dwrnw

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: crx kml mkrMdu ris hoie Bvr lY vwsu luBwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kamal Makarandu Rasi Hoi Bhavaru Lai Vaasu Loubhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Like the black bee they surrender at the lotus feet of Guru and enjoy the  sap and remain happy.

lines.gurmukhi: ieVw ipMglw suKmnw lMiG qiRbyxI inj Gir AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Irhaa Pingulaa Soukhamanaa Laghi Tribaynee Nij Ghari Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: They go beyond the triveni of ira, pingala and  susumna and stablize in their own self.

lines.gurmukhi: swih swih mn pvx ilv sohM hMsw jpY jpwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Saahi Saahi Manu Pavan Liv Sohan Hansaa Japai Japaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: They through the flame of breath,  mind and the life force, recite and make others recite the soham and hans  recitations (jap).

lines.gurmukhi: Acrj rUp AnUp ilv gMD sugMD Avys mcwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Acharaj Roop Anoop Liv Gandh Sougandhi Avaysu Machaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The form of surati is wonderfully fragrant and  enrapturing.

lines.gurmukhi: suK swgr crxwribMd suK sMpt ivic shij smwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Soukhasaagar Charanaarabind Soukh Sanpat Vichi Sahaji Samaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs  calmly absorb in the pleasure-ocean of the  Guru feet.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl iprm rsu dyh ibdyh prm pd pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Piram Rasu Dayh Bidayh Param Padu Paavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: When they in the form of pleasure-fruit obtain the supreme joy,  they go beyond the bondages of body and bodylessness and attain the  highest station.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq imil AlK lKwvY ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Sangati Mili Alakhu Lakhaavai ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such gurmukhs have the glimpse of that invisible Lord in  the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 h`QwN dI sPlqw

Shabad OS B.translation: The usefulness of hands

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK hiQ skQ hin swDsMgiq gur kwr kmwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Hadi Sakad Hani Saadhasangati Gur Kaar Kamaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Worthy are the hands of the Sikh who in the holy congregation do the  Guru's work.

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI pKw pIhxw pYr Doie crxwNmqu pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Pakhaa Peehanaa Pair Dhoi Charanaamatu Paavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Who draw water, fan the sangat, grind the flour, wash the  feet of Guru and drink the water therefrom;

lines.gurmukhi: gurbwxI iliK poQIAw qwl miRdMg rbwb vjwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurabaanee Likhi Potheeaa Taal Mridang Rabaab Vajaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Who copy the Guru's hymns  and play the cymbals, the mirdang, a small drum, and the rebeck in the  company of holy.

lines.gurmukhi: nmskwr fMfauq kir gurBweI gil imil gil lwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Namasakaar Dandaout Kari Gurabhaaee Gali Mili Gali Laavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Worthy are the hands who bow, help in prostrating and  embrace a brother Sikh;

lines.gurmukhi: ikriq ivriq kir Drm dI hQhu dykY Blw mnwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Kirati Virati Kari Dharam Dee Hathahu Day Kai Bhalaa Manaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Who eam livelihood honestly and munificently  confer favour on others.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrs pris Apris hoie pr qn pr Dn hQu n lwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Paarasu Parasi Aparasi Hoi Par Tan Par Dhan Hadu N Laavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Worthy of praise are the hands of such a Sikh  who by coming in touch with Guru becomes indifferent to worldly  materials and lays not his eyes on another's wife or property;

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK gur isK pUj kY Bwie Bgiq BY Bwxw BwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Gur Sikh Pooj Kai Bhaai Bhagati Bhai Bhaanaa Bhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Who loves  another Sikh and embraces the love, devotion, and fear of God;

lines.gurmukhi: Awp gvwie n Awp gxwvY ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Ganaavai ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: He effaces his ego and does not assert himself.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 crx sPlqw

Shabad OS B.translation: The usefulness of feet

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pYr skwrQy gurmuiK mwrig cwl clMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Pair Sakaaraday Guramoukhi Maaragi Chaal Chaladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Blessed are the feet of the Sikhs who walk in Guru's way;

lines.gurmukhi: gurU duAwrY jwin cil swDsMgiq cil jwie bhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Guroo Duaarai Jaani Chali Saadhasangati Chali Jaai Bahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Who go to the  Gurudwara and sit their in the holy congregation;

lines.gurmukhi: Dwvn praupkwr no gur isKw no Koij lhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Dhaavan Paraoupakaar No Gur Sikhaa No Khoji Lahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Who search out the  Guru's Sikhs and hasten to do them favours.

lines.gurmukhi: duibDw pMQ n DwvnI mwieAw ivic audwsu rhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Doubidhaa Panthi N Dhaavanee Maaiaa Vichi Udaasu Rahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Worthy are the feet of the  Silk's who do not go on the way of duality and possessing wealth remain indifferent to it.

lines.gurmukhi: bMid KlwsI bMdgI ivrly kyeI hukmI bMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Bandi Khalaasee Bandagee Viralay Kayee Houkamee Banday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Few are the people who abide by the orders of the  Supreme Commander, do Him homage and thus escape from their bonds;

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKw prdKxwN pYrI pY rhrwis krMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhaa Paradakhanaan Pairee Pai Raharaasi Karanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Who adopt the custom of circumambulating the Guru's Sikhs and falling at  their feet.

lines.gurmukhi: gur cyly prcY prcMdy ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Chaylay Parachai Parachanday ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru's Sikhs delight in such enjoyments.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 gurmuK propkwrI

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh, the altruist

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK min prgwsu hY iprm ipAwlw Ajru jrMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikh Mani Paragaasu Hai Piram Piaalaa Ajaru Jaranday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The enlightened mind of the Sikhs drinks and digests the unbearable cup  of the love of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm pUrn bHm bHmu ibbykI iDAwnu DrMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Brahamu Bibaykee Dhiaanu Dharanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Armed with the knowledge of the Brahm, they  meditate upon the transcendental Brahm.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilvlIx hoie AkQ kQw gur sbd suxMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Leen Hoi Akad Kadaa Gur Sabadu Sounanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Merging their consciousness in  the Word-sabad, they recite the indescribable story of the Word-the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: BUq BivKhuN vrqmwn Aibgiq giq Aiq AlK lKMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Bhoot Bhavikhahoun Varatamaan Abigati Gati Ati Alakh Lakhanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: They are competent to see incomprehensible pace of the past, present and  future.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu AClu Clu Bgiq vClu kir AClu ClMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Achhalu Chhalu Bhagati Vachhalu Kari Achhalu Chhaladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Never deluding fruit of joy, the gurmukhs get, and with grace of the  God, kind to devotees, they rather delude the evil propensities.

lines.gurmukhi: Bvjl AMdir boihQY ieks ipCy lK qrMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Bhavajal Andari Bohidai Ikas Pichhay Lakh Taranday.

Shabad OS B.translation: They work  as a boat in the world-ocean and ferry across the millions who follow one  gurmukh, the Guru-oriented person.

lines.gurmukhi: praupkwrI imlin hsMdy ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Paraoupakaaree Milani Hasanday ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: The altruist Sikhs always come up smiling.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 GrbwrI is`K dI rihxI

Shabad OS B.translation: The conduct of the house holder Sikh

lines.gurmukhi: bwvn cMdn AwKIAY bhly ibsIAr iqsu lptwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Baavan Chandan Aakheeai Bahalay Biseearu Tisu Lapataahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The snakes are said to be coiled around the sandal tree (but the tree is not  influenced by their poison).

lines.gurmukhi: pwrsu AMdir pQrw pQr pwrs hoie n jwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Paarasu Andari Padaraa Padar Paarasu Hoi N Jaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The philosopher's stone exists among stones  but does not turn out to be an ordinary stone.

lines.gurmukhi: mxI ijnHwN spw isrIN Eie iB spw ivic iPrwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Manee Jinhaan Sapaan Sireen Aoi Bhi Sapaan Vichi Dhiraahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The jewel-holding snake also  roams about among the ordinary snakes.

lines.gurmukhi: lhrI AMdir hMsuly mwxk moqI cuig cuig KwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Laharee Andari Hansulay Maanak Motee Chougi Chougi Khaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: From the waves of the pond, the  swans pick up only pearls and gems to eat.

lines.gurmukhi: ijauN jl kvl Ailpq hY GirbwrI gurisK iqvwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Jioun Jali Kaval Alipatu Hai Gharibaaree Gurasikhi Tivaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the lotus remains  unsmeared in water, the same is the position of the householder Sikh.

lines.gurmukhi: Awsw ivic inrws hoie jIvn mukiq jugiq jIvwhI
lines.transliteration_english: Aasaa Vichi Niraasu Hoi Jeevanu Moukati Jougati Jeevaahee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He  residing among all the hopes and cravings around, adopts the skill of  liberation in life and lives (happily).

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq ikqu muiK swlwhI ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Sangati Kitu Muhi Saalaahee ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: How could one eulogise the holy  congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 siqgur Aqy is`K ausquiq

Shabad OS B.translation: The True Guru and praise

lines.gurmukhi: DMnu DMnu siqgur purKu inrMkwir Awkwr bxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannu Dhannu Satigur Purakhu Nirankaari Aakaaru Banaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The formless Lord has assumed the form of true Guru, the blessed one.

lines.gurmukhi: DMnu DMnu siqgur isK suix crix srix gurisK ju AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannu Dhannu Satigur Sikh Souni Charani Sarani Gurasikh Juaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fortunate is the Sikh of the Guru who listening to the teaching of the Guru  has sought the shelter of the Guru-feet.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrg DMnu hY swDsMgiq imil sMgu clwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Maaragu Dhannu Hai Saadhasangati Mili Sangu Chalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The way of the gurmukhs is  blessed on which one treads through the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: DMnu DMnu siqgur crx DMnu msqku gur crxI lwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannu Dhannu Satigur Charan Dhannu Masataku Gur Charanee Laaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Blest is feet of  the true Guru and that head is also fortunate which reposes on the feet of Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur drsnu DMnu hY DMnu DMnu gurisK prsix AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Darasanu Dhannu Hai Dhannu Dhannu Gurasikh Parasani Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The glimpse of the true Guru is auspicious and the Sikh of the Guru  is also blessed one who has come to have sight of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: Bwau Bgiq gurisK ivic hoie dieAwlu gurU muih lwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaau Bhagati Gurasikh Vichi Hoi Daiaalu Guru Muhi Laaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru  loves happily the devotional feelings of the Sikh.

lines.gurmukhi: durmiq dUjw Bwau imtwieAw ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Doojaa Bhaau Mitaaiaa ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: The wisdom of the Guru  decimates duality.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 sPl smyN

Shabad OS B.translation: The blessed time

lines.gurmukhi: DMnu plu csw GVI phr DMnu DMnu iQiq su vwr sBwgy
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannu Palu Chasaa Gharhee Paharu Dhannu Dhannu Diti Su Vaar Sabhaagay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Blessed is the moment, the blinking time, the hour, the date, the day  (during which you remember the Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: DMnu DMnu idhu rwiq hY pKu mwh ruiq sMmiq jwgy
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannu Dhannu Dihu Raati Hai Pakhu Maah Routi Sanmati Jaagay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Day, night, fortnight, months,  season and the year are auspicious wherein mind tries to rise (to divinity).

lines.gurmukhi: DMn ABIcu inCqRR hY kwmu kRoD AhMkwr iqAwgy
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannu Abheechu Nichhatr Hai Kaamu Krodh Ahankaaru Tiaagay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Blessed is the abhijit nakstra which inspires to repudiate the lust, the anger  and the ego.

lines.gurmukhi: DMnu DMnu sMjogu hY ATsiT qIrQ rwj iprwgy
lines.transliteration_english: Dhannu Dhannu Sanjogu Hai Atdasatdi Teerad Raaj Piraagay.

Shabad OS B.translation: That time is fortunte wherein (through meditation on God)  one gets the fruits of the holy dip at the sixty eight pilgrim centers and the  Prayagraj.

lines.gurmukhi: gurU duAwrY Awie kY crx kvl rs AMmiRq pwgy
lines.transliteration_english: Guroo Duaarai Aai Kai Charan Kaval Ras Anmritu Paagay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Reaching the door of Guru (the Gurudwara) mind gets absorbed  in the delight of the lotus feet (of Guru).

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdysu Avysu kir AnBY iprm iprI Anurwgy
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Oupadaysu Avaysu Kari Anabhai Piram Piree Anuraagay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Adopting the teachings of Guru,  the state of fearlessness and total absorption in the love (of Lord) is  attained.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv swDsMig AMig AMig iek rMig smwgy
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadi Surati Liv Saadhasangi Angi Angi Ik Rangi Samaagay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Immersing the consciousness in the sabad (word) through and in  the holy congregation, every limb ( of the devotee) reverberates the lustre  of the (steadfast) colour of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: rqn mwl kir kcy Dwgy ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Ratanu Maalu Kari Kachay Dhaagay ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikhs of the Guru have made  jewel garland of the fragile thread of breath (and they make full use of the same).

lines.gurmukhi: 18 GrbwrI jIvn mukq

Shabad OS B.translation: A liberated house holder

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK imTw bolxw jo bolY soeI jpu jwpY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Mitdaa Bolanaa Jo Bolai Soee Japu Jaapai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The polite language of a Sikh brings out what he thinks in his mind and  heart.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK AKI dyKxw bHm iDAwn DrY Awpu AwpY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Akhee Daykhanaa Braham Dhiaanu Dharai Aapu Aapai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A Sikh beholds God everywhere with his own eyes, and that is  equal to a yogi's meditation.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK sunxw suriq kir pMc sbdu gur sbid AlwpY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sounanaa Surati Kari Panch Sabadu Gur Sabadi Alaapai.

Shabad OS B.translation: When a Sikh listens attentively to, or himself  sings, the word of God, that is equal to the five ecstatic sounds in the brain  of a yogi.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK ikriq kmwvxI nmskwru fMfauiq is\\\\wpY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Kirati Kamaavanee Namasakaaru Dandaouti Siaapai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Earning livelihood with his hands by a Sikh is equal to the  obeisance and prostration (of Hindus).

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK mwrig clxw prdKxw pUrn prqwpY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Maaragi Chalanaa Paradakhanaa Pooran Parataapai.

Shabad OS B.translation: When, the gurmukh, walks to  behold the Guru, that is equal to an extremely holy circumambulation.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK Kwxw pYnxw jog Bog sMjog pCwpY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Khaanaa Painanaa Jag Bhog Sanjog Pachhaapai.

Shabad OS B.translation: When the Guru oriented person eats and clothes himself, that is equal to the performance of Hindu sacrifice and offering.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK svxu smwiD hY Awpy Awip n Qwip auQwpY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Savanu Samaadhi Hai Aapay Aapi N Daapi Udaapai.

Shabad OS B.translation: When gurmukh sleeps,  that is equal to a yogi's trance and the gunnukh withdraws not his  thoughts from the object (God the Guru) of his concentration.

lines.gurmukhi: GrbwrI jIvn mukiq lihr nhIN Bv loB ibAwpY
lines.transliteration_english: Gharabaaree Jeevan Moukati Lahari N Bhavajal Bhau N Biaapai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The  householder is liberated in life; he is not afraid of the waves of the world's  ocean and fear does not enter his heart.

lines.gurmukhi: pwir pey lMiG vrY srwpY ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Paari Paay Laghi Varai Saraapai ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: He goes beyond the region of  blessings and curses, and does not utter them.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 gurmuK dI Dwrnw

Shabad OS B.translation: The realization by Gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur siq srUp hY iDAwn mUlu gur mUriq jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Sati Saroopu Hai Dhiaan Moolu Gur Moorati Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: That the true Guru is the truth incarnate and is the basis of meditation is  well known (to gurmukh).

lines.gurmukhi: siqnwmu krqw purKu mUl mMqRR ismrx prvwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Sati Naamu Karataa Purakhu Mool Mantr Simaranu Paravaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Satnam, Karta Purakh is accepted as the  basic formula, the muli mantr, by gurmukh.

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl mkrMd rsu pUjw mUl iprm rs mwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Makarand Rasu Poojaa Moolu Piram Rasu Maanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He accepting the sweet sap of  the lotus feet as fundamental, quaffs the joy of love for the supreme.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv swDsMig gur ikrpw qy AMdir AwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Saadhasangi Gur Kirapaa Tay Andari Aanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He  enters into the immersion of word-consciousness through the Guru and  the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pMQ AgMmu hY gurmiq inhcl clx BwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Pandu Aganmu Hai Guramati Nihachalu Chalanu Bhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The way of the gurmukh is beyond the ken of mind  and speech and he in accordance with the wisdom of the Guru and his own  steadfast will, treads on it.

lines.gurmukhi: vyd kqybhuN bwhrI AkQ kQw kaux AwiK vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Vayd Kataybahoun Baaharee Akad Kadaa Kaounu Aakhi Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Who can describe the importance of the  parable (of gurmukh) because it is beyond the Vedas and the Katebas, (the  four holy books of semitic religion).

lines.gurmukhi: vIh iekIh aulMiG is\\\\wxY ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Veeh Ikeeh Ulaghi Siaanai ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: This way can be identified only by  crossing the limits and anxieties about the high and low of the world.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 mnmuK gqI

Shabad OS B.translation: Position of a Manmukh

lines.gurmukhi: sIs invwey FINgulI gil bMDy jlu aucw AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Seesu Nivaaay Ddheengulee Gali Bandhay Jalu Ouchaa Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: To get water from a stream or pond, the dhingali (a pole with a bucket one end and a fulcrum in the middle used for drawing water) is lowered by  catching hold of its neck, i.e. it is humbled forcibly and does not go down  of its own.

lines.gurmukhi: GuGU suJ n suJeI ckeI cMd n ifTw BwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghoughoo Sujhu N Sujhaee Chakaee Chandu N Ditdaa Bhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The owl is not pleased on beholding the sun or chakavi; ruddy  sheldrake, the moon.

lines.gurmukhi: isMml ibrK n sPlu hoie cMdn vwsu n bwNs smwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sinmal Birakhu N Saphalu Hoi Chandan Vaasu N Vaansi Samaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The silk cotton (simbal) tree yields no fruit and the  bamboo grows near the sandal but is not perfumed thereby.

lines.gurmukhi: spY duDu pIAwlIAY qumy dw kauVqu n jwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sapai Dudhu Peeaaleeai Toumay Daa Kaurhatu N Jaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Given milk to  drink a serpent does not part with its poison and the bitterness of the colocynth also does not depart.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau Qix cMbiV iccuVI lohU pIAY duDu n KwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Dani Chanbarhi Chichurhee Lohoo Peeai Dudhu N Khaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The tick clings to the cow's udder but  drinks blood instead of milk.

lines.gurmukhi: sB Avgux mY qin vsin gux kIqy Avgux no DwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabh Avagoun Mai Tani Vasani Goun Keetay Avagoun No Dhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: All these demerits I have and if any one do  me a favour, I return it with undesirable trait.

lines.gurmukhi: Qom n vwsu kQUrI AwvY ]20]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Dom N Vaasu Kadooree Aavai ?20?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Garlick can never have the  perfume of musk.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: Awid AMiq ibsmwd Pl dRum gur isK sMD giq
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Anti Bisamaada , Dhal Droum Gur Sikh Sandh Gati ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the puzzle of seed and tree as to who came first is strange and perplexing, similarly strange is understanding the meeting of Guru and Sikh.

lines.gurmukhi: Awid prm prmwid AMq AnMq n jwnIAY ]1]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Param Paramaadi , Ant Anant N Jaaneeai ?1?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: This mystery of the beginning and end is beyond comprehension. Lord is beyond, away and infinite.

lines.gurmukhi: Pl dRum gurisK sMD giq Awid AMq ibsmwid
lines.transliteration_english: Dhal Droum Gursikh Sandh Gati , Aadi Ant Bisamaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru Ram Das caused the meeting of Guru and Sikh in the same wondrous way of fruit and tree.

lines.gurmukhi: AMq AnMq n jwnIAY Awd prm prmwid ]2]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Ant Anant N Jaaneeai , Aad Param Paramaadi ?2?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: That perspective is infinite and no one can understand it. It is beyond, away and still away out of the reach of mortals.

lines.gurmukhi: Awid prm prmwid nwd imil nwd sbd Duin
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Param Paramaadi , Naad Mili Naad Sabad Dhouni ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the sound of musical instruments melds with the words (of song/hymns), similarly Guru Ram Das and Guru Arjan became indistinguishable.

lines.gurmukhi: sillih sill smwie nwd srqw swgr suin
lines.transliteration_english: Salilahi Salil Samaai , Naad Sarataa Saagar Souni ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the river water becomes inseparable from the water of the ocean, Guru Arjan became one with Guru Amar Das by engrossing himself in his precepts and following them obediently.

lines.gurmukhi: nrpiq suq niRp hoq joiq gurmuiK gun gur jn
lines.transliteration_english: Narapati Sout Nrip Hota , Joti Gurmukhi Goun Gur Jan ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as son of a king becomes king, similarly Guru Arjan born as son to Guru Ram Das became an enlightened soul by singing the eulogies of Lord-a boon blessed to him by Satguru.

lines.gurmukhi: rwm nwm prswid Bey gur qy guru Arjn ]3]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Raam Naam Parasaadi Bhaay , Gur Tay Guru Arajan ?3?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: By the grace of Guru Ram Das, Arjan Dev succeeded him as Guru Arjan Dev.
